args: Back again? You truly never grow weary\nof this, do you?
I wanted to thank you for saving my life.
That, and... It gladdens me that you\nagreed to team up.
Our interests aligned. That is all.
But you're glad you did it, yes?
Do you still not think there's a way for\nhumans and dragons to live together?
It is true there was meaning in joining\nhands with you in this isolated endeavor...
But the last days' events have also served\nto show the boundless foolishness of man.
Those soldiers slew their own in an effort\nto summon calamity upon the very world\nthat gave them life and sustained them.
How is one to share a vision of the world\nwith a race so benighted?
I can't deny this has been a showcase\nof humanity's worst traits, and I blame\nno one for thinking us fools.
But humanity's greatest strength is our\nability to change, and I'm not ready to\ngive up on our possibilities just yet.
Untested and impossible are two different\nbeasts, and the wise do not make habit of\ndeclaring what shall never come to pass.
You are a human, so I would hear\nhow YOU propose to change.
First, I will cease coming here.
I will undertake a journey and travel\nthe world on my own two feet.
I first came here because I wanted to see\na wider world than the one I knew.
But I've realized there is much you cannot\nsee by simply gazing down from on high.
I want to meet all manner of souls—\nhuman, dragon, and otherwise—who think\ndifferently than I and learn from them.
Also, I'm worried about this empire the\nsoldier mentioned, so I wish to know\nmore of what's happening in the world.
Would you care to join me?
What better place to test whether or not\nhumans and dragons can live together\nthan on the open road?
I see you've no intention of changing\nyour propensity for mad delusion.
Oh, but I'm serious. If the world's as wide\nas they say, maybe we'll find something\nthat turns your natural order on its head.
Maybe, but that possibility is\nwhat I choose to believe in.
(Thinking back, this human has ever\nbelieved in what the future might hold.)
(The laws of the world are bedrock—yet to\nhold them as such is to reject change.)

(A world unchanging means history is
condemned to repeat—and perhaps that
is the ultimate consequence of an
unchallenged order.)
(If that order could be changed, would the\nworld and the future change with it?)
Just how is it you mean to alter the very\nfoundations of our world, human?
By the two of us working together\nto solve this mystery.
I fear we cannot allow that.
The world shall not be permitted to\nfall into chaos once more! Haaaah!
And if someone should arise\nto shatter that old order?
(If protecting the world order means\nrepeating the mistakes of the past...)
(Then will shattering that order and giving\nrise to a new one bring a different future?\nA better future, one that evades disaster...)
Hmm? Why'd you suddenly change form?
A matter of convenience when traveling\nthe roads with a human.
You have my thanks; I will feel much\nbetter out there with you at my side!
Be warned: I join not to aid, but to judge.\nI would see if you are truly fit to\nreshape the world's laws.
You swore to dig up my bedrock and sculpt\nit into something better, did you not?
I did, and I will. It's good to have you\nalong for the journey, Midgardsormr.
(Perhaps you truly are the one to punch\na hole in this long-stagnant order.)
Indeed it has. You have changed much\nsince departing on that journey.
Is that why you haven't shown up\nin my dreams since that day?
Heh. You would ask a question despite\nalready knowing its answer?
Then I will provide the answer as well as\nthe question: These dreams are my own\ndoubt given form—doubt sown by Alberius.
Doubt from being bound by the old order,\nyet glimpsing the possibility of a bond\nbetween dragon and human.
Then I ask you once more, Midgardsormr:\nCan dragon and man forge a true bond?
They can. The days I lived with Alberius\nin centuries past are proof of this—\nand those bonds continue through time.
I shall protect this world he created,\nwhere dragon and man can journey as one.
Then it seems the promise is kept.
A personal matter. I suspect we will not\nhave the chance to speak again.
Then let me ask, if this be our final\nmeeting: Who ARE you?
O great dragon of the forest!\nIf you can hear my voice, then heed my\ncall. Grant me the pactstone's power!
It seems the time to awaken is come.\nGo, then. A new pact awaits you.
I leave the world to come in your care.
(I do not need to be asked to do my duty.)
(I carry with me the will of Alberius,\nand I shall see it done.)
Now prove your feeble flesh can withstand\nthe supreme power of a dragon!
And so the story finds its next hero...
